intro: Clinanthus fulvus, commonly known as the yellow-flowered clinanthus, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy aroma. Clinanthus fulvus is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
